title: MINUTE ChIP

source.description: Harvest 10^6 cells, spin, flash freeze the pellet.

source.body: Make sure cell pellet is frozen with as little excess liquid as possible

source.description:
On the day of experiment resuspend in
of ice cold PBS.

Add
of MNase mix (final 2U/ul in 2xLyB for mouse embryonic stem cells).

source.body:
MNase mix :
First add 20 μl protease inhibitor to 1 ml 2x lysis buffer (2xLyB)
Stepwise dilute MNase (M0247S NEB 2000 U/ul ) to 20U/μl and then 2U/μl in 2x LyB
Final working conc. = 2U/μl in 2xLyB.

source.description:
Resuspend, rotate for 5 mins, magnetize and aspirate :
2x with 500 μl ice cold RIPA buffer
1x with 500 μl ice cold RIPA/high salt buffer
2x with 500 μl ice cold LiCl wash buffer
1x with 200 μl ice cold TE (quick wash and change to new tube)
Transfer supernatant to a fresh tube.

source.body: Remember to save appropriate amount of the pool as input ( Usually 5-10% of the volume used for the IPs)

source.body: It is advisable to take as much ChIP DNA as possible into the IVT reaction to maximize the library diversity

source.body: There is no 'right' amount of ChIP DNA. Selective antibodies against low abundant targets will yield little DNA

source.description:
Mix and incubate with agitation at 800 rpm at
for
and then at
overnight.

source.body: The manufacturer's protocol for the end repair and blunt end ligation suggests 60 minutes incubation at room temperature.We have obtained satisfactory results with just 2 hours incubation at room temperature. The overnight incubation is therefore optional and was introduced more as a break point for the protocol.

description: The need for quantitative ChIP-seq has been widely appreciated, and a number of quantitative methods have been proposed. Mint-ChIP, developed by the Bernstein lab provides a streamlined one-pot chromatin barcoding and a post ChIP linear amplification that requires only one adaptor per chromatin fragment. Here, we introduce unique molecule (unique molecular identifier [UMI]) counting and paired-end mapping of the chromatin fragments to this method, which we then termed MINUTEChIP for multiplexed indexed unique molecule T7 amplification end-to-end sequencing. For paired-end mapping, we modified the linear amplification strategy introduced in Mint-ChIP by priming the cDNA synthesis from a 30 adaptor (RA3) ligated onto the amplified RNA, thus maintaining the original genomic fragment length, retrieving atypical mononucleosomal fragment length for histone ChIP. We have also optimized the ligation conditions and stoichiometry of adaptors to chromatin to enable sequencing of the input. We show that MINUTE-ChIP is a sensitive method with a large linear dynamic range for accurately quantifying relative differences in genome-wide histone modification patterns across multiple pooled samples.
